newsitem.title: USA: Computer Assocs ships new Unicenter in volume.
newsitem.headline: Computer Assocs ships new Unicenter in volume.

text.p: Computer Associates International Inc said Wednesday it had begun full-scale distribution of Unicenter TNG (The Next Generation), its new system for managing large enterprise computer networks.

Unicenter TNG is designed to help centrally manage, monitor and control all the information technology resources located worldwide in an organization -- from desktop computers to the mainframe, from local area networks to the Internet.
Since May, Unicenter TNG has been in controlled release to selected clients and strategic partners. To date, hundreds of businesses worldwide have begun installing the new system.
Unicenter TNG is designed to operate on various UNIX software systems and on Microsoft Corp's Windows NT running on Intel Corp and Digital Equipment Corp Alpha microprocessors.
Pricing starts at $2,500, the company said.
